name: fortinet-fortisandbox
label: Fortinet FortiSandbox
description: FortiSandbox utilizes advanced detection, dynamic antivirus scanning, and threat scanning technology to detect viruses and APTs. FortiSandbox executes suspicious files in the VM host module to determine if the file is High, Medium, or Low Risk based on the behaviour observed in the VM sandbox module. Implemented actions like submit file, get scan stats, get file verdict, get job behaviour and get pdf report etc.

fields.title: Server URL
fields.tooltip: URL of the Fortinet FortiSandbox server to which you will connect and perform automated operations.
fields.description: URL of the Fortinet FortiSandbox server to which you will connect and perform automated operations.
fields.name: server
instance_type
fields.title: Instance Type
fields.tooltip: Select whether you are using an on-premise (VM or Hardware appliance) FortiSandbox appliance or FortiSandbox Cloud
fields.description: Select the instance type from the following options: OnPremise, Cloud.

OnPremise.title: Username
OnPremise.tooltip: Username of the Fortinet FortiSandbox server to which you will connect and perform automated operations.
OnPremise.description: Username of the Fortinet FortiSandbox server to which you will connect and perform automated operations.
OnPremise.name: username

OnPremise.title: Password
OnPremise.tooltip: Password used to access the Fortinet FortiSandbox server to which you will connect and perform the automated operations.
OnPremise.description: Password used to access the Fortinet FortiSandbox server to which you will connect and perform the automated operations.
OnPremise.name: password

Cloud.title: API Authentication Token
Cloud.description: FortiSandbox Cloud Token for API authenticate. You can generate a token with the command: login-token -g on FortiSandbox Cloud.
Cloud.tooltip: FortiSandbox Cloud Token for API authenticate. You can generate a token with the command: login-token -g on FortiSandbox Cloud.
Cloud.name: api_token

fields.title: Verify SSL
fields.name: verify_ssl
fields.description: Specifies whether the SSL certificate for the server is to be verified or not. By default, this option is set to True.

operations.description: Submits a file to Fortinet FortiSandbox based on the attachment ID or indicator IRI you have specified.
operations.title: Submit File

parameters.name: input_type
parameters.title: Indicator IRI/Attachment ID
parameters.tooltip: File type support: 32bit and 64bit executable file, applies to all the Portable Executables (PE) files. Any text based file, such as HTML,VBA,VBS, JS, PDF, BAT, SH, PHP, XML, power shell scripts, archive formats like .tar, .gz, .tar.gz, .tgz, .zip, .bz2, .rar,office documents, PDFs are also supported.
parameters.description: Select whether you want to submit an Indicator IRI or an Attachment ID to Fortinet FortiSandbox. Select from the following options: Indicator IRI, Attachment ID. Specify the ID of the attachment that you want to submit to Fortinet FortiSandbox, in the Attachment ID field. Attachment IRIs are used to access the file directly from the FortiSOAR™ Attachments module. NOTE: Following file types are supported: 32bit and 64bit executable files including all the Portable Executables (PE) files text-based file such as, HTML, VBA, VBS, JS, office documents, PDF, BAT, SH, PHP, XML PowerShell scripts archive formats like .tar, .gz, .tar.gz, .tgz, .zip, .bz2, and .rar

Attachment ID.name: attachment_iri
Attachment ID.title: Attachment IRI
Attachment ID.tooltip: Specify the ID of the attachment that you want to submit to Fortinet FortiSandbox.
Attachment ID.description: Specify the ID of the attachment that you want to submit to Fortinet FortiSandbox, in the Attachment ID field. Attachment IRIs are used to access the file directly from the FortiSOAR™ Attachments module.

Indicator IRI.name: indicator_iri
Indicator IRI.title: Indicator IRI
Indicator IRI.tooltip: Specify the IRI of the indicator that you want to submit to Fortinet FortiSandbox.
Indicator IRI.description: Specify the IRI of the indicator that you want to submit to Fortinet FortiSandbox, in the Indicator IRI field.

parameters.name: overwrite_vm_list
parameters.title: VM Name
parameters.tooltip: Scan specified file through provided vm. If not specified, defaults one will be used.
parameters.description: (Optional) Name of the VM that will scan the specified URL file. If you do not specify a VM Name, then the VM Name will default to the one being used.

operations.description: Submits a URL(s) to Fortinet FortiSandbox.
operations.title: Submit URL

parameters.name: url
parameters.title: URL
parameters.tooltip: Provide URL in list format or single value.
parameters.description: URL that you want to submit to Fortinet FortiSandbox. Note: You can submit a single URL or multiple URLs in a list format.

parameters.name: overwrite_vm_list
parameters.title: VM Name
parameters.tooltip: Name of the VM that will scan the specified URL.
parameters.description: (Optional) Name of the VM that will scan the specified URL. If you do not specify a VM Name, then the VM Name will default to the one that will be used.

parameters.name: timeout
parameters.title: Timeout
parameters.tooltip: How long the scan will be, in seconds.
parameters.description: (Optional) Time after which the scan will timeout, i.e., the time in seconds of the length of the scan. By default, the timeout value is set to 60 seconds.

parameters.name: depth
parameters.title: Depth
parameters.tooltip: The depth of web links to scan.
parameters.description: (Optional) This option specifies the depth of web links this operation should scan. Select this option, i.e., set to True, to crawl into the links of the specified URL for scanning purposes. Deselect this option, i.e., set to False, to scan only the specified URL and not any links within the URL.

operations.description: Retrieves the status of the system from Fortinet FortiSandbox.
operations.title: Get System Status

operations.description: Retrieves the scan stats for the last 7 days from Fortinet FortiSandbox.
operations.title: Get Scan Stats

operations.description: Retrieves all job IDs associated with the submission ID you have specified from Fortinet FortiSandbox.
operations.title: Get Submission Job List

parameters.name: sid
parameters.tooltip: The submission ID got from submit file.
parameters.description: The ID of the submission whose associated Job IDs you want to retrieve from Fortinet FortiSandbox.
parameters.title: Submission ID

operations.description: Retrieves job verdict detail for job ID you have specified from Fortinet FortiSandbox.
operations.title: Get Job Verdict Detail

parameters.name: jid
parameters.title: Job ID
parameters.description: The ID of the job whose job verdict details you want to retrieve from Fortinet FortiSandbox.

operations.description: Retrieves file rating for the file type and filehash you have specified from Fortinet FortiSandbox.
operations.title: Get File Rating

parameters.title: Hash Type
parameters.name: hash_type
parameters.description:
Type of the filehash based on which you want to retrieve the file rating from Fortinet FortiSandbox.
You can choose from the following values: MD5, SHA1, or SHA256.
parameters.tooltip: Type of the filehash based on which you want to retrieve the file rating from Fortinet FortiSandbox.

parameters.title: Filehash
parameters.name: file_hash
parameters.tooltip: Provide the value of filehash (considering the filehash type you have chosen from the Hash Type drop-down list)
parameters.description: Value of the filehash (considering the filehash type you have chosen from the Hash Type drop-down list) based on which you want to retrieve the file rating from Fortinet FortiSandbox.

operations.description: Get rating details for the URL you have specified from Fortinet FortiSandbox.
operations.title: Get URL Rating

parameters.title: URL
parameters.name: url
parameters.tooltip: Provide the value in list format or single value.
parameters.description: URL for which you want to retrieve the rating details from Fortinet FortiSandbox.

operations.description: Retrieves the file verdict details for the file type and filehash you have specified from Fortinet FortiSandbox.
operations.title: Get File Verdict

parameters.title: Hash Type
parameters.name: hash_type
parameters.description:
Type of the filehash based on which you want to retrieve the file verdict details from Fortinet FortiSandbox.
You can choose from the following values: MD5, SHA1, or SHA256.
parameters.tooltip: Type of the filehash based on which you want to retrieve the file verdict details from Fortinet FortiSandbox.

parameters.title: Filehash
parameters.name: file_hash
parameters.tooltip: Provide the value of filehash (considering the filehash type you have chosen from the Hash Type drop-down list)
parameters.description: Value of the filehash (considering the filehash type you have chosen from the Hash Type drop-down list) based on which you want to retrieve the file verdict details from Fortinet FortiSandbox.

operations.description: Retrieves job behavior details associated with the file type and filehash you have specified from Fortinet FortiSandbox.
operations.title: Get Job Behaviour

parameters.title: Hash Type
parameters.name: hash_type
parameters.description: Type of the filehash whose associated job behavior details you want to retrieve from Fortinet FortiSandbox. You can choose from the following values: MD5, SHA1, or SHA256.
parameters.tooltip: Type of the filehash whose associated job behavior details you want to retrieve from Fortinet FortiSandbox.

parameters.title: Filehash
parameters.name: file_hash
parameters.tooltip: Provide the value of filehash (considering the filehash type you have chosen from the Hash Type drop-down list)
parameters.description: Value of the filehash (considering the filehash type you have chosen from the Hash Type drop-down list) whose associated job behavior details you want to retrieve from Fortinet FortiSandbox.

operations.description: Retrieves AV-Rescan results for the time duration you have specified from Fortinet FortiSandbox.
operations.title: Get AV-Rescan Result

parameters.title: From
parameters.name: stime
parameters.description: Start DateTime from when you want to retrieve the AV-Rescan results from Fortinet FortiSandbox.
parameters.tooltip: Start datetime from when you want to retrieve the AV-Rescan results.

parameters.title: To
parameters.name: etime
parameters.description: End DateTime till when you want to retrieve the AV-Rescan results from Fortinet FortiSandbox.
parameters.tooltip: End datetime till when you want to retrieve the AV-Rescan results.

parameters.title: Need AV Version
parameters.name: need_av_ver
parameters.tooltip: If true, only return AV version.
parameters.description: (Optional) Select this option, i.e., set it to True, if you want this operation to return only the AV version. By default, this is deselected, i.e., set as False.

operations.description: Retrieves the names and the clone numbers of all installed VMs on Fortinet FortiSandbox.
operations.title: Get All Installed VM

operations.description: Retrieves a PDF report from Fortinet FortiSandbox based on the query type and value parameter you have specified and creates an attachment in the FortiSOAR™ Attachment module if the report is found.
operations.title: Get PDF Report

parameters.title: Query Type
parameters.name: qtype
parameters.description: Type of query to be used to retrieve the PDF report from Fortinet FortiSandbox. Note: Query type only supports SHA256 filehash.

parameters.title: Query Value
parameters.name: qval
parameters.tooltip: Provide the value of sha256 to fetch the report
parameters.description: Value of the SHA256 filehash based on which you want to retrieve the PDF report from Fortinet FortiSandbox.

operations.description: Retrieves a list of file hashes or URLs based on the type you have specified from the Malware Package or URL Package in Fortinet FortiSandbox.
operations.title: List Filehash or URL From Malware Package or URL Package

parameters.title: Type
parameters.name: type
parameters.tooltip: Select the type which you want to download from malware package or url package.
parameters.description: Type, based on which you want to retrieve a list of file hashes or URLs from the Malware Package or URL Package in Fortinet FortiSandbox. You can choose from the following values: MD5, SHA1, SHA256, or URL.

parameters.title: Lazy
parameters.name: lazy
parameters.tooltip: False: use specified major and minor number; True: get the latest version.
parameters.description: Use this parameter to specify the major and minor numbers of the Malware Package or the URL Package. If you clear this option, i.e., set it to False, then the list of file hashes or URLs is retrieved from the Malware Package or URL Package of the specified major and minor number. If you select this option, i.e., set it to True, then the latest version of the Malware Package or URL Package is used to retrieve the list of file hashes or URLs.

false.title: Major Number
false.name: major
false.tooltip: Specify major number of the Malware Package or the URL Package to be used to retrieve the list of file hashes or URLs.
false.description: Major number of the Malware Package or the URL Package to be used to retrieve the list of file hashes or URLs.

false.title: Minor Number
false.name: minor
false.tooltip: Specify minor number of the Malware Package or the URL Package to be used to retrieve the list of file hashes or URLs.
false.description: Minor number of the Malware Package or the URL Package to be used to retrieve the list of file hashes or URLs.

operations.description: Marks specified sample based on the Job ID you have specified as false negative or false positive in Fortinet FortiSandbox.
operations.title: Toggle FPN State

parameters.title: Job ID
parameters.name: jid
parameters.description: Job ID that you want to mark as false negative or false positive in Fortinet FortiSandbox.

parameters.title: Comments
parameters.name: comments
parameters.description: Comments that you want to provide for marking the specified job as false negative or false positive.
parameters.tooltip: Comments that you want to provide for marking the specified job as false negative or false positive.

operations.description: Updates an existing whitelist or an existing blacklist in Fortinet FortiSandbox, based on the input parameter such as indicator type and value, and action you have specified.
operations.title: Update White or Black List

parameters.title: List Type
parameters.name: list_type
parameters.description:
Type of list on Fortinet FortiSandbox in which you want to add the indicator.
You can select from the following list types: White or Black.
parameters.tooltip: Type of list on Fortinet FortiSandbox in which you want to add the indicator.

parameters.title: Indicator Type
parameters.name: indicator_type
parameters.description:
Type of indicator that you want to add to the whitelist or blacklist in Fortinet FortiSandbox.
You can choose from the following values: MD5, SHA1, SHA256, Domain, URL, or URL Regex.
parameters.tooltip: Type of indicator that you want to add to the whitelist or blacklist in Fortinet FortiSandbox.

parameters.title: Action
parameters.name: action
parameters.description:
Action that you want to apply on the whitelist or blacklist in Fortinet FortiSandbox, i.e., you can choose to append the specified indicator to the whitelist or blacklist in Fortinet FortiSandbox, or you can choose to delete the specified indicator from the whitelist or blacklist in Fortinet FortiSandbox.
You can choose from the following actions: Append, Replace, Clear, Download, or Delete.
parameters.tooltip: Action that you want to apply on the whitelist or blacklist in Fortinet FortiSandbox. If you select DOWNLOAD then attachment is created in FortiSOAR™ based on the other input parameters that you have specified.

APPEND.title: Indicator Value
APPEND.name: indicator_value
APPEND.tooltip: Provide the value of indicator in list format or single value that you want to add to the whitelist or blacklist in Fortinet FortiSandbox.
APPEND.description: Value of the indicator (considering the Indicator type you have chosen from the Indicator Type drop-down list) that you want to add to the whitelist or blacklist in Fortinet FortiSandbox.

REPLACE.title: Indicator Value
REPLACE.name: indicator_value
REPLACE.tooltip: Provide the value of indicator in list format or single value that you want to replaced to the whitelist or blacklist in Fortinet FortiSandbox.
REPLACE.description: Value of the indicator (considering the Indicator type you have chosen from the Indicator Type drop-down list) that you want to replaced to the whitelist or blacklist in Fortinet FortiSandbox.

DELETE.title: Indicator Value
DELETE.name: indicator_value
DELETE.tooltip: Provide the value of indicator in list format or single value that you want to delete from the whitelist or blacklist in Fortinet FortiSandbox.
DELETE.description: Value of the indicator (considering the Indicator type you have chosen from the Indicator Type drop-down list) that you want to delete from the whitelist or blacklist in Fortinet FortiSandbox.
